Getting started¶

Diagnostic Efficiency¶

Load the package de. The calculation of the diagnostic efficiency can be easily demonstrated on the provided example dataset.

In [1]: from de import de

In [2]: from de import util

# path to example data
In [3]: path = '/Users/robinschwemmle/Desktop/PhD/diagnostic_efficiency/examples/camels_example_data/13331500_05_model_output.txt'

# import observed time series
In [4]: df_ts = util.import_camels_obs_sim(path)

# make numpy arrays
In [5]: obs_arr = df_ts['Qobs'].values

In [6]: sim_arr = df_ts['Qsim'].values

# calculate the diagnostic efficiency
In [7]: de.calc_de(obs_arr, sim_arr)
Out[7]: 0.6215739994904088

Diagnostic polar plot¶

In [8]: from de import de

In [9]: from de import util

# path to example data
In [10]: path = '/Users/robinschwemmle/Desktop/PhD/diagnostic_efficiency/examples/camels_example_data/13331500_05_model_output.txt'

# import observed time series
In [11]: df_ts = util.import_camels_obs_sim(path)

# make numpy arrays
In [12]: obs_arr = df_ts['Qobs'].values

In [13]: sim_arr = df_ts['Qsim'].values

# display diagnostic polar plots
In [14]: de.diag_polar_plot(obs_arr, sim_arr)
Out[14]: <Figure size 600x600 with 2 Axes>
